item.description:
PLEASE -- TAKE A FEW MINUTES AND REVIEW ALL THE TRIP DETAILS BELOW.

EVENT ORGANIZER: Julie Moran Contact me here: jmmoran {{AT}} nycap.rr.com, Mobile 281-5882.

Mount Mansfield (elevation 4,393 feet) is the highest mountain in Vermont. From the east its ridge resembles the profile of a human face, and the names of its prominent features reflect this: Adams Apple (4,060'), Chin (4,393', highest point), Nose (4,062') and Forehead (3,940'). For about 2.3 miles (from the Forehead to Adams Apple) the Long Trail is almost constantly above treeline, the only such long stretch of alpine zone in Vermont. The initial climb is strenuous and difficult; the rest of the trip is a ridge walk and is relatively easy.


"The Forehead," summit of Mt. Mansfield in the warm blue summertime.


UPDATES (11/04/2009 12:15 PM):

THIS IS PLANNED AS A WEEKEND TRIP, REPEATED BY POPULARITY FROM OCTOBER. We'll travel to the Schenectady Wintersports Lodge (in Waterbury Center, VT) Friday evening ($20 / night -- private room, full kitchen, fireplace!).

CLICK HERE for a link to the location of the clubhouse -- it's the big white house right next to the Cold Hollow Cider Mill with "SWC" written in large black letters on the front.

CLICK HERE for a Google image -- note the second driveway to the right past the cider mill sign, the gravel parking area and the large white house approaching ...

CLICK HERE for a Google image -- a close-up of the SWC clubhouse, gravel parking lot and the side door entrance.

***We'll leave for the trailhead about 6:30 a.m. to enjoy a full day over Vermont's highest trail. We can return home that evening ... or enjoy dinner in Stowe that evening, then make a leisurely return home the next day. If the weather isn't favorable for hiking Saturday, you can stay over for a Sunday attempt on the mountain ... or if weather permits, on Sunday we can climb Vermont's second highest peak, nearby Camel's Hump.

This trip will also include a stop at a local brewery -- the Shed Restaurant And Brewery on Mountain Road is a logical first choice -- great beer, great food, great bar atmosphere!



LODGING DETAILS UPDATE:


  • Your "Yes" RSVP by November 11th will reserve your lodging; if you have not RSVP by then and decide you still want to go, email me; I may be able to add you to the reservation list.
  • To attend you must do two sign-ups: (1) PRELIMINARY SIGNUP: If you haven't already, please email me (Julie Moran, jmmoran {{ AT }} nycap.rr.com) your First and Last Name, cell phone and email address. If I've not received your confirmation email information by November 11th, your "Yes" or "Maybe" RSVP will be changed to a "No" and your name will not be included on the reservation. (2) ON-ARRIVAL SIGNUP: As you enter the clubhouse door (side of the building, entered from the parking lot), you must sign the sign-up sheet.
  • Your "Maybe" RSVP will be converted to a "No" by November 11th. "Maybe" RSVPs are not added to the reservation list.
  • As the number of attendees increases, there's a chance many of us may not be able to get a private room, in which case you can select a hostel style sleeping area. Rooms labeled "Couples Rooms" are for couples only.
  • Be sure to bring a sleeping bag or comforter. There are pillows and blankets available at the lodge.
  • You pay lodging fees to me via PayPal or Amazon Payments, or pay cash Friday night to me. You can add Saturday night by paying me an additional $20 on Saturday and, if needed, alter your sign-up information.
  • If you joined Hiking Mates CHALLENGE and haven't already, please pay our $5 annual membership fee when you arrive. - Julie.




CLICK HERE FOR TRIP PLANNER -- VIEW / PRINT / TAKE WITH YOU
(Total miles, 7.2; Total Climb, 3,628' ASL)

CLICK HERE FOR A TOPO MAP / HIKE ROUTE.


TRAILHEAD START TIME: 7:15 a.m., Hell Brook Trail, located approximately 1.25 miles north of the Long Trail south trailhead off Route 108.

NOTE: This hike includes a CAR SPOT at the Lake Mansfield Trout Club at the end of Nebraska Valley Road. The route planned will change if we've not enough cars. Also, the Notch Road will be closed at the first significant snowfall; if the gate into the notch is closed, that will add about two miles to the hike.

CLICK HERE for Google Maps Trailhead Directions, Distances from the Schenectady Wintersports Lodge to the CAR SPOT at the Lake Mansfield Trout Club on Nebraska Valley Road near Stowe, VT, and then to the trailhead at Smuggler's Notch, VT.


An evening picture near Mt. Mansfield, with Lake Champlain visible off in the distance.



WEATHER AND OTHER SUDDEN EVENTS CAN CAUSE SUDDEN CHANGES TO OR CANCELLATION OF THIS EVENT. YOU MUST CHECK BACK TO THE MEETUP.COM SITE OFTEN FOR UPDATES TO ANY HIKING MATES CHALLENGE EVENT.


ESSENTIALS TO BRING: Flash light AND head lamp, food / snacks / at least three bottles of water, first aid items. Wear multiple layers of synthetic materials for warmth; consider bringing charcoal warmers for fingers and toes.

NOTE: Poles and friction devices for boots, such as micro-spikes, "Yak-Traks" or crampons, are recommended as added gear should wet rock surfaces freeze. Snow shoes may be required -- stay tuned for weather updates. CLICK HERE FOR CURRENT SNOW DEPTH INFORMATION FOR VERMONT.

ADDITIONAL POLICIES / REQUIREMENTS / ITEMS: None.


YOUR RESEARCH ESSENTIALS:

Mt. Mansfield:
http://home.earthlink...
http://www.summitpost...
http://alavigne.net/O...


NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any challenge hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going and how to get back. As with all HM CHALLENGE TRIPS, BE SURE TO READ OUR GUIDELINES.

See you there! Julie.
item.how_to_find_us: Look for my Green Honda Element
item.name: GREEN MOUNTAIN SERIES: Early Winter On Vermont's Highest, Mt. Mansfield
